text: [Music]
after two weeks of non-stop exploring
Iran this Middle Eastern country has
quickly become one of my favorites in
the world this trip has been eye-opening
and life-changing in every way
imaginable so when you're walking around
this place it's like a maze all the
little rooms it didn't take long for me
to realize that all stereotypes about
Iran are false this country is not what
you hear about on TV it's exactly the
opposite from the ancient history to the
smiling faces and everything in between
here are seven things I love most about
Iran one Iranian wrestling
Virginie Bustani is the name of this
sport which is a well-known Persian
tradition it's basically an old system
to Train Iranian warriors by using a
combination of martial arts and strength
training while a guy beats the drum
watching this was one of the more
interesting things I've witnessed and
I'll never forget it
to caravanserai eyes all right we just
pulled up to our cutter van today stay
for the night these are former roadside
places to sleep for travelers and
merchants and today thousands of them
can be found all over Iran you could
think of a caravanserai as the oldest
form of a hotel and we had the
opportunity to sleep in one in the
middle of the desert three at the people
I cannot mention the beauty of Iran
without talking about its people they
are the kindest most humble and
hospitable humans that reside on our
planet it's one of the very few places
I've been where they simply want to get
to know you instead of getting inside
your wallet I feel so comfortable that I
could easily live here hello Salaam
Salaam booby
how are you Salaam Ruby for ancient
history
Iran is home to one of the world's
oldest civilizations dating back 40,000
years it has been incredible to learn
about purchase history from our G
Adventures guide Ameen hey guys
as we visited many historical sites from
the rise of the Persian Empire was Cyrus
the Great - the unique source Aryan
religion and Islamic influence from the
7th century there is so much to discover
in this vast lands 5 Persepolis
Persepolis was used as a very ceremonial
capital for Persian kings the best and
most famous historical site in Iran and
my personal favorite was Persepolis
dating back to 518 BC Persepolis was the
capital of the a commanded Empire and
it's still remarkably intact to the
point of extremely detailed inscriptions
on the stone I don't know how this place
is not a seven wonder of the world six
lamb kebabs I've hardly talked about
Persian food because I'm too obsessed
with the people and history of Iran but
I'd like to tell you that it's delicious
most dishes have a combination of rice
with meat vegetables nuts and fruit
pomegranates - the flavorings include
saffron lime cinnamon and parsley my
favorite Iranian dish and the one that I
ate almost every day was the lamb kebab
seven Persian Gardens
despite 2/3 of Iran being covered in
desert somehow people were able to build
the most amazing green Gardens hundreds
of years ago in fact the gardens of Iran
are so impressive that they are listed
as a unesco world heritage site as you
can see my love for Iran is getting
stronger by the day I cannot stress how
happy I am in this country and I will
definitely be back here again soon
any questions about Iran please comment
down below or stay tuned for my upcoming
Q&A
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
